answer_found_by_llm: Unable to confirm suspicious login activity due to corrupted capture.log file (invalid data length error).
The attacker used sqlmap (User-Agent: "sqlmap/1.6#stable") and python-requests (User-Agent: "python-requests/2.28.1"), indicating potential SQL injection and automated HTTP request tools.
The exploited plugin is Simple File List version 5.0 (CVE-2019-17558), identified via POST requests to /wp-content/plugins/simple-file-list/ee-file-engine.php and ee-upload-engine.php.
The attacker uploaded a file named fr34k.php, located at /wp-content/uploads/simple-file-list/fr34k.php.
The final HTTP response code for the last access to fr34k.php in the logs is 200.
